org.spongepowered.api.util.blockray

Class BlockRay.BlockRayBuilder<E extends Extent>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.spongepowered.api.util.blockray.BlockRay.BlockRayBuilder<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - The type of the extend for the block ray
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<BlockRayHit<E>>
    Enclosing class:
    BlockRay<E extends Extent>

    public static class BlockRay.BlockRayBuilder<E extends Extent>
extends Object
implements Iterable<BlockRayHit<E>>
    A builder for block ray, which also implements Iterable, which makes it useful for 'advanced for loops'. Use BlockRay.from(Location) to get an instance.

    • Method Detail

      • filter

        public BlockRay.BlockRayBuilder<E> filter(Predicate<BlockRayHit<E>> filter)
        Adds the filter to the block ray. This is optional. Multiple filters will be ANDed together.
        Parameters:
        filter - The filter to add
        Returns:
        This for chained calls

        Returns:

      • to

        public BlockRay.BlockRayBuilder<E> to(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3d end)
        Sets the direction and ending location. This or setting the direction is required and can only be done once.
        Parameters:
        end - The ending location
        Returns:
        This for chained calls

      • direction

        public BlockRay.BlockRayBuilder<E> direction(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3d direction)
        Sets the direction. This or setting the ending location is required and can only be done once.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        This for chained calls

      • blockLimit

        public BlockRay.BlockRayBuilder<E> blockLimit(int blockLimit)
        Sets the maximum number of blocks to intersect before stopping. This is a safeguard to prevent infinite iteration. Default value is 1000. Use a negative value to disable this.
        Parameters:
        blockLimit - The block limit
        Returns:
        This for chained calls

      • build

        public BlockRay<E> build()
        Returns a block ray build from the settings. An ending location or direction needs to have been set.
        Returns:
        A block ray

      • iterator

        public Iterator<BlockRayHit<E>> iterator()

      • end

        public Optional<BlockRayHit<E>> end()
        Iterates the built block ray until the end and returns the last hit, if any.
        Returns:
        The last block hit, if any
        See Also:
        build(), BlockRay.end()
